supply_logistics.supply_status: Complete collapse in 1943-Q2. After Mareth Line battle (March 1943) and Wadi Akarit breakthrough (6-7 April), division retreated to Enfidaville with catastrophic supply losses. Fuel completely exhausted - all motor transport immobilized by mid-April. Ammunition rationed to emergency defensive fire only. Water distribution crisis. Food supplies down to captured stocks and emergency rations. Division effectively static and awaiting final Allied assault by late April 1943.

weather_environment.terrain_type: Tunisian coastal plains near Enfidaville - defensive positions in final perimeter

tactical_doctrine.role: Shattered defensive infantry division in final Tunisia Campaign battles. Division suffered devastating losses at Mareth Line (March 1943), fought delaying action at Wadi Akarit (6-7 April 1943), then retreated to Enfidaville perimeter where it remained static until final surrender May 13, 1943. By April 1943, division reduced to approximately 34% of March strength due to combat casualties and prisoners.

strength_attrition_1943q2.reason: No specific casualty reports for 1943-Q2. Wikipedia reports division 'lost half its strength' at Mareth Line (March 1943), then fought through Wadi Akarit (6-7 April 1943) before final surrender May 13. Estimated 34% reduction from 1943-Q1 (8,200 to 5,400) based on documented heavy combat losses.
sources_checked: Wikipedia: 80th Infantry Division La Spezia - Mareth Line losses
Battle of Wadi Akarit historical accounts
strength_attrition_1943q2.mitigation: Italian casualty records, German liaison reports on Italian unit strength, Allied intelligence assessments, First Italian Army records, prisoner interrogation reports
strength_attrition_1943q2.estimate_method: Applied 34% attrition from 1943-Q1 baseline (8,200) to reach 5,400 for 1943-Q2. Based on: (1) Division lost 50% strength at Mareth Line per Wikipedia, (2) Further losses at Wadi Akarit 6-7 April, (3) Continued attrition April-May in Enfidaville perimeter, (4) Final surrender May 13. Cumulative losses from January-May estimated at 66% (9,500 to 5,400 at surrender).

equipment_losses_1943q2.reason: No detailed equipment status reports for 1943-Q2 final battles. Estimated catastrophic vehicle losses (45% reduction from Q1) and artillery losses (38% reduction) based on Mareth Line battle, Wadi Akarit breakthrough, and retreat to Enfidaville with fuel exhaustion.
equipment_losses_1943q2.mitigation: Italian quartermaster records, German maintenance reports, captured equipment inventories, Allied intelligence reports on Italian 1st Army, surrender documents
equipment_losses_1943q2.estimate_method: Vehicles reduced from 385 (Q1) to 210 (Q2) - 45% loss reflecting combat losses, mechanical breakdown during retreat, fuel exhaustion immobilizing remaining trucks. Artillery reduced from 68 to 42 pieces (38% loss) - guns lost in combat at Mareth/Wadi Akarit, abandoned during retreat, ammunition exhaustion. Armored cars from 9 to 4 (56% loss) - reconnaissance vehicles particularly vulnerable during withdrawal battles.
